com.percussion.extensions.general
Class PSAddCurrentDateTime

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSDefaultExtension
      com.percussion.extensions.general.PSAddCurrentDateTime
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPSExtension, IPSRequestPreProcessor
public class PSAddCurrentDateTime
extends PSDefaultExtension
implements IPSRequestPreProcessor

This class is a Rhythmyx pre-exit that adds the current date and time as an HTML parameter to the provided request. The date/time is formatted according to the provided format pattern or if not provided to the default pattern (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss).
Having this value in an HTML Parameter is useful when building time dependent selection conditions, such as will be encountered during incremental publishing of content.
Note that the time added by this exit is relative to the clock of the Rhythmyx server, not the clock of the database server. The date and time will be relative to the default locale.
There are four optional parameters to this exit, viz. name of the HTML parameter ,format pattern string, date time offset, and truncate.

Method Detail

preProcessRequest

public void preProcessRequest(Object[] params,
                              IPSRequestContext request)
                       throws PSExtensionProcessingException,
                              PSParameterMismatchException
Adds a the current date and time to the provided request.

Specified by:
preProcessRequest in interface IPSRequestPreProcessor
Parameters:
params - the array of parameter objects. There are two parameters: params[0] is optional, specifying the parameter name added to the request. If not provided, the default name 'sys_NOW' be used. May be null or empty. params[1] is optional, specifying the format pattern string how to format the date/time string added. If not provided, the default (yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss) will be used. May be null or empty. params[2] is optional, specifying a date offset. examples: 1 will return tomorrows date -1 will return yesterdays date -3 will return the date as of three days ago params[3] is optional, if set to "yes" we will truncate the time to 12:00:00 AM
request - the request context for the exit, assumed not null.
Throws:
PSParameterMismatchException - if the HTML parameter name is not supplied or empty.
PSExtensionProcessingException - If any other exception occurs which prevents the proper handling of this request

getDateOffset

public static Date getDateOffset(Date date,
                                 int offset,
                                 boolean truncate)
Sets an offset for the the date passed in and returns a new date adjusted by the number of days passed in as the offset integer value. Negative integers will set the date backwards. Positive integers will set the date forward.

Parameters:
date - the date to be offset
offset - the number of hours to offset the date passed in. Can be negative, positive or zero.
truncate - flag to indicate if we want to truncate this date/time
